page.title: 03FARM BUILDINGS
page.content: This area is very rural and still retains an air of calm and tranquillity. Many of the farms buildings were built during the 14th & 15th centuries.Some still show their original form but others have been 'modernised' ,putting a Georgian or Victorian front onto the building. Several of them still retain a pond, usually in the form of a moat surrounding the immediate premises of the farm. Most of the farm houses are now private residences and the land is farmed from else where. Near Hole Farm a grove of willow trees has been planted, growing for the making of Cricket bats in about 15 years time.
